The disease entity in the paragraph is "catalepsy". It is a condition characterized by a rigid, fixed posture and a decreased sensitivity to external stimuli. In this context, it is used as an indicator of the effects of a certain drug.

The only disease entity in the paragraph is "catalepsy". The other term "atypical antipsychotic" is a type of medication used to treat certain mental/mood disorders (such as schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, or irritability associated with autistic disorder). It does not refer to a disease.
